subject   : Subject: CLOSING THE GAP (10-2-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 1 Oct 2020 17:20:13 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*Can we boast, then, that we have done anything to *

*be excepted by God? No because our acquittal is*

* not based on our good deeds. It is based on our*

* faith. So we are made right with God through faith *

*and not by obeying the law. *(Ro 3:27-28)



*Today’s Reflection**:*

Most religions require specific duties that must be pre-

formed to make a person acceptable to a god. *Chris-*

*tianity is unique in that no good deed that* *we do will*

* make us right with God. No amount of human achieve-*

*ment or personal goodness will close the gap between*

* God’s moral perfection and our imperfect daily perfor-*

*mance. Good deeds are important BUT they will not*

*earn us eternal life. We are saved only by trusting in*

* what God has done. *(see Eph. 2:8-10)

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Most religions require specific duties that must be preformed to make a person acceptable to a god. Christianity is unique in that no good deed that we do will make us right with God. No amount of human achieve ment or personal goodness will close the gap between God’s moral perfection and our imperfect daily performance. Good deeds are important BUT they will not earn us eternal life. We are saved only by trusting in what God has done. (see Ephesians 2:8-10)
original_verse_text:
Can we boast, then, that we have done anything to  be excepted by God? No because our acquittal is not based on our good deeds. It is based on our
 faith. So we are made right with God through faith 
and not by obeying the law.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the truth that no amount of our own good works can make us right with You. Your Word reminds us that we are saved by grace through faith, not by our own efforts (Ephesians 2:8-9). We acknowledge our imperfections and our inability to bridge the gap between our sinfulness and Your perfect holiness. Lord, we cling to the promise that our salvation is found in trusting in what You have done for us through Jesus Christ. May we walk in the good works You have prepared for us, not as a means of earning Your favor, but as a response to Your unfailing love. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.

No amount of human achieve ment or personal goodness will close the gap between God’s moral perfection and our imperfect daily performance. Good deeds are important BUT they will not earn us eternal life. We are saved only by trusting in what God has done. (see Ephesians 2:8-10)

*Subject: THE POWER OF JESUS’ LOVE (*10-3-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*People are declared righteous because of their faith, *

*not **because of their work. *(Ro. 4:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*When some people learn that they are saved by *

*God **through **faith, they start to worry. “Do I have *

*enough **faith?” they** wonder, “Is my faith strong *

*enough to **save me?” These** people miss the point. *

*It is Jesus **Christ who saves us, not** our feelings or *

*actions, **and He is strong enough to save** us no *

*matter **how weak our faith is. Jesus offers us sal-*

*vation as a gift because He loves us, not because *

*we **have earned it through our powerful faith. What, *

*then,** is the role of faith? Faith is believing and trust-*

*ing in Jesus Christ and reaching out to accept His *

*wonderful gift of Salvation.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: When some people learn that they are saved by God through faith, they start to worry. “Do I have enough faith?” they wonder, “Is my faith strong enough to save me?” These people miss the point. It is Jesus Christ who saves us, not our feelings or actions, and He is strong enough to save us no matter how weak our faith is. Jesus offers us sal ovation as a gift because He loves us, not because we have earned it through our powerful faith. What, then, is the role of faith? Faith is believing and trust ing in Jesus Christ and reaching out to accept His wonderful gift of Salvation.
original_verse_text: People are declared righteous because of their faith,  not because of their work.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our salvation is not earned by the strength of our faith, but is a gracious gift from You through Jesus Christ. Help us to trust in Your unfailing love and the power of Christ's sacrifice, rather than focusing on the perceived weakness of our own faith. May we reach out in faith to accept Your wonderful gift of salvation, resting in the assurance that You are strong enough to save us, no matter how frail we may feel. In Your Son's precious name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: When some people learn that they are saved by God through faith, they start to worry. “Do I have enough faith?” they wonder, “Is my faith strong enough to save me?” These people miss the point. It is Jesus Christ who saves us, not our feelings or actions, and He is strong enough to save us no matter how weak our faith is. Jesus offers us salvation as a gift because He loves us, not because we have earned it through our powerful faith. What, then, is the role of faith? Faith is believing and trusting in Jesus Christ and reaching out to accept His wonderful gift of salvation.
subject: The Power of Jesus’ Love
verse_text: People are declared righteous because of their faith,  not because of their work.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Therefore since we have been made right in God’s *

*sight by faith, **we have peace with God because of *

*what Jesus Christ our Lord** has done for us. *(Ro. 5:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We now have peace with God, which may be differ

from peacefull feelings such as calmness and tran-

quility. Peace with God means that we have been reconciled with Him. There
is no more hostility be-

tween us , no sin blocking our relationship with Him.

*Peace with God is possible only because Jesus paid *

*the price for **our sins through His death on the cross*. (Ro. 5:1)

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
We now have peace with God, which may be differ from peacefully feelings such as calmness and tran quility. Peace with God means that we have been reconciled with Him. There is no more hostility be tween us , no sin blocking our relationship with Him.
Peace with God is possible only because Jesus paid the price for our sins through His death on the cross. (Romans 5:1)

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ, we have been reconciled to You and now have peace with You. No longer are we at enmity, but we have been brought near by the blood of Christ. (Colossians 1:20) Help us to rest in this profound truth, to walk in the light of Your love, and to live as those who have been made whole. May our lives reflect the peace we have found in You. Amen.

There is no more hostility between us, no sin blocking our relationship with Him. Peace with God is possible only because Jesus paid the price for our sins through His death on the cross. (Romans 5:1)

*Subject: THE DANGER OF CRITICISM *(10-5-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*Accept Christians who are weak in the faith, and do not*

*argue with them about what they think is right or wrong.*

(Ro. 14:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

These verse assumes there will be differences of opinion

in the church about what is right and wrong. Paul says

we are not to quarrel about issues that are on matters of

opinion. Differences should not be feared or avoided

but accepted and handled with love. Do not expect every-

one, even in the best possible church, to agree on every

subject. Through sharing ideas we can come to a fuller

understanding of what the Bible teaches. Accept—listen

to—*and* respect others. *Differences of opinion need not*

*cause divisions. They can be a source of learning and*

*riches in our relationships.*

* Pastor Sather*

opinion.
Differences should not be feared or avoided
but accepted and handled with love. Do not expect every one, even in the best possible church, to agree on every
subject.
Through sharing ideas we can come to a fuller
understanding of what the Bible teaches. Accept-listen
to-and respect others. Differences of opinion need not cause divisions. They can be a source of learning and riches in our relationships.
original_verse_text: Accept Christians who are weak in the faith, and do not argue with them about what they think is right or wrong.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the diversity of perspectives and opinions that exist within Your church. Help us to follow the example of Your Son, who welcomed and accepted all who came to Him. Grant us the wisdom to listen to one another, to respect our differences, and to seek understanding rather than division. May our disagreements be a source of learning and growth, as we strive to discern Your will more fully. Guide us, Lord, to live in harmony and love, as You have called us to do. Amen.
reflection: These verses assume there will be differences of opinion in the church about what is right and wrong. Paul says we are not to quarrel about issues that are on matters of opinion. Differences should not be feared or avoided but accepted and handled with love. Do not expect everyone, even in the best possible church, to agree on every subject. Through sharing ideas, we can come to a fuller understanding of what the Bible teaches. Accept, listen to, and respect others. Differences of opinion need not cause divisions. They can be a source of learning and riches in our relationships.
subject: The Danger of Criticism

*Today’s Verses:*

*To one person the Spirit gives the ability to give wise advice; **to
another He gives the gift of special know-*

*ledge. The Spirit **gives special faith to another, and to someone else He
gives **the power to heal the sick. *

(I Cor. 12:8-9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

All Christians have faith. Some, *however*, have the *spiritual *gift of
faith, *which* is an unusual measure

of trust in the power of God. No matter what gifts a

person has, each gift is given by the Holy Spirit. We

are responsible to use and sharpen our gifts, *but we *

*can take no credit for What God **has freely given *

*us.*

* Pastor Sather*

No matter what gifts a person has, each gift is given by the Holy Spirit. We are responsible to use and sharpen our gifts, but we can take no credit for What God has freely given us.

Grant us the gift of faith to trust in Your power and provision, even in the face of life's challenges. Help us to steward our gifts faithfully, giving all glory and honor to You. Amen.

*Today’s Verses:*

*Examine yourselves to see if your faith is really genuine. Test
yourselves. **If you cannot tell that Jesus Christ is among you, it means
you have **failed the test, I hope *

*you recognize that we have passed the test and **are approved by God. *(2
Cor. 13:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Corinthians were called to examine and test them-selves to see if they
were Christians. Just as we get

physical checkups, Paul urges us to give ourselves

spiritual checkups. We should look for a growing

awareness of Christ’s presence and power in our

life. Then we will know if we are true Christians or merely imposters. *If
we are not **actively seeking to *

*grow **closer **to God, we are drawing farther **away *

*from **Him.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: The Corinthians were called to examine and test themselves to see if they were Christians. Just as we get physical checkups, Paul urges us to give ourselves spiritual checkups. We should look for a growing awareness of Christ’s presence and power in our life. Then we will know if we are true Christians or merely imposers. If we are not actively seeking to grow closer to God, we are drawing farther away from Him.
original_verse_text: Examine yourselves to see if your faith is really genuine. Test yourselves. If you cannot tell that Jesus Christ is among you, it means you have failed the test, I hope  you recognize that we have passed the test and are approved by God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to examine ourselves and test the genuineness of our faith. Help us to discern whether we are truly walking in the footsteps of Your Son, Jesus Christ, or if we are merely imposters, content with a superficial relationship with You. Grant us the wisdom and courage to honestly assess our spiritual condition, that we may grow ever closer to You and bear the fruit of a life transformed by Your Spirit. May our actions and obedience to Your commands be a testament to the reality of Your presence in our lives. We pray this in the name of Jesus, our Lord and Savior. Amen.
reflection: The Corinthians were called to examine and test themselves to see if they were Christians. Just as we get physical checkups, Paul urges us to give ourselves spiritual checkups. We should look for a growing awareness of Christ's presence and power in our lives. Then we will know if we are true Christians or merely imposters. If we are not actively seeking to grow closer to God, we are drawing farther away from Him.

subject   : Subject: THE SECRET TO BECOMING GOD'S CHILD (10-8-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 7 Oct 2020 18:01:48 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*The Law was our guardian and teacher to lead us*

*until Christ came. So now, through faith in Christ,*

*we are made right with God. But now that faith in*

*Christ has come, we no longer need the law as our*

*guardian. So you are all children of God through*

*faith in Christ. *(Gal. 3:24-26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The picture of the law as a guardian is similar to

a tutor giving a young child supervision. We no

longer need that kind of supervision. The Law

teaches us *our need* of salvation, God’s grace

gives us that salvation. The Old Testament still

applies today. In it, God reveals His nature—His

will for humanity—His moral laws—and His

guidelines for living. *But we cannot be saved*

* by the law, we must trust in Christ.*

* Pastor Sather*

guidelines for living. But we cannot be saved by the law, we must trust in Christ.

So you are all children of God through faith in Christ.

We praise You that through faith in Christ, we are no longer under the guardianship of the law, but are Your beloved children, free to live in the power of Your Spirit. Help us to walk in obedience to Your Word, not out of duty, but out of love and gratitude for the grace You have so freely given us. In Jesus' name, Amen.

subject   : Subject: A SURE WAY TO MONITOR YOUR FAITH (10-9-20)

*Today’s Verses:*

*We who live by the Spirit eagerly wait to receive every-*

*thing **promised to us who are right with God through faith. For **when we
place our faith in Christ Jesus, it makes no diff**erence to God whether we
are circumcised or not circum**cised. What is important is faith expressing
itself *

*in love.*

(Gal. 5:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We are saved by faith not deeds. But love for others and

for God is the response of those whom God has forgiven.

God’s forgiveness is complete, and Jesus said that those

who are forgiven much, love much (Lk. 7:47). Because

faith expresses itself through love, *you can check your*

*love for others as a way to monitor your faith.*

* Pastor Sather*

We are saved by faith not deeds. But love for others and
for God is the response of those whom God has forgiven.
God’s forgiveness is complete, and Jesus said that those
who are forgiven much, love much (Luke 7:47).
Because
faith expresses itself through love, you can check your love for others as a way to monitor your faith.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that we are saved by Your grace through faith, not by our own works. May Your Holy Spirit fill our hearts with Your love, that we may love You and our neighbors with sincere and sacrificial devotion. Help us to demonstrate the depth of Your forgiveness through the love we extend to others, that our faith may be evident and bring glory to Your name. Amen.

message_id: 1750f44bee5b08ad
subject   : Subject: UNITY IN THE BODY OF CHRIST (10-10-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 9 Oct 2020 16:29:25 -0500

Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*there is one body and one Spirit—just as you were called to the one hope
that belongs to your call—one Lord, one faith, one baptism, one God and
Father of all, who is over all and through all and in all. But grace was
given to each one of us according to the measure of Christ’s gift.*

(Eph. 4:4-7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This is possibly a quotation of an early Christian hymn or creed. We see
other examples in (I Cor.12:3-6). We need to remember the Church’s unity is
rooted in the Trinity: *one Spirit* (v.4) *one Lord* (v. 5) *one Father*
(v.6). There

are seven “ones” God’s number of completeness. *One body. *The oneness of
the Church,is rooted in Christ Himself, into whom we are baptized (Ro.
12:5; I Cor. 12:13),* one Spirit. *That same indivisible Spirit unities

us all. The *one Lord* mentioned in v.5 is a confession

of Jesus as Yahweh, true God (Ro. 10:9); (I Cor. 12:3). The *one* *faith *is
not an act of believing, *but* what is believed: *true doctrine*, as
confessed through the Apostles’ Creed at Baptism (Col. 2:6-7) *one
baptism, *Although Baptism as new birth cannot be repeated (nor may “Spirit
Baptism” be separated from “water Baptism”), that is not the emphasis
here. Rather, Paul teaches that there is only one Baptism, into which
Christ Himself and all Christians are baptized and thereby joined. For the
true unity of the Church it is enough to agree about the doctrine of the
Gospel and the administration of the Sacraments. *It is NOT necessary* *that
human traditions, that is, rites *

*or ceremonies instituted by men, should be the same everywhere.*

* Paster Sather*

We need to remember the Church’s unity is rooted in the Trinity: one Spirit (v.4) one Lord (v. 5) one Father (v.6). There are seven “ones” God’s number of completeness. One body. The oneness of the Church,is rooted in Christ Himself, into whom we are baptized (Romans 12:5; I Corinthians 12:13), one Spirit. That same indivisible Spirit unities us all.
The one Lord mentioned in v.5 is a confession of Jesus as Yahweh, true God (Romans 10:9); (I Corinthians 12:3). The one faith is not an act of believing, but what is believed: true doctrine, as confessed through the Apostles’ Creed at Baptism (Colossians 2:6-7) one baptism, Although Baptism as new birth cannot be repeated (nor may “Spirit Baptism” be separated from “water Baptism”), that is not the emphasis here. Rather, Paul teaches that there is only one Baptism, into which Christ Himself and all Christians are baptized and thereby joined. For the true unity of the Church it is enough to agree about the doctrine of the Gospel and the administration of the Sacraments. It is NOT necessary that human traditions, that is, rites or ceremonies instituted by men, should be the same everywhere. Paster Sather

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the unity we have in Your Church, rooted in the blessed Trinity. By the power of Your Spirit, we are one body, one faith, and one baptism, united in our confession of Jesus as the one Lord. Grant us wisdom to discern the essentials of the Gospel and to hold fast to the truth, even as we embrace the diversity of human traditions. May our oneness in Christ be a witness to the world. Amen.

message_id: 17514926550cd997
subject   : Subject: FAITH IS YOUR SHIELD (10-11-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*In every battle you will need faith as your shield to stop*

* the fiery arrows aimed at you by Satan. *(Eph, 6:16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In the Christian life we battle against rulers and author-

ities (the powerful evil forces of fallen angels headed by Satan, who is a
victories fighter, see I Pet 5:8). To with-stand their attacks we must
depend on God’s strength

and use every part of His armor. Paul is not only giving this counsel to the
church, the body of Christ, but to all individuals within the church. The
whole body needs to

*Truly if they had called to mind that country from which they had come
out, They** would have found a way to go back—BUT they were looking for a

*to be called their God, **for He has prepared a heavenly city for

*Today’s Reflection:*

These people of faith died without receiving all that

God had promised, *but* they never lost their vision of heaven (“A better
place, a heavenly homeland”). Many

Christians have become frustrated and defeated because their needs, and
wants, expectations, and demands are

not immediately met when they accept Christ as Savior.

They become impatient and want to quit. Are you discour-aged because the
achievement of your goals seems far away? Take* courage from these heroes **of
faith, who lived and died without seeing the fruit of their faith *

*on* *earth **and* * yet continued to believe. (for further insight look at
Heb. 11:36-39)*

* Pastor Sather*

subject   : Subject: PROFITING FROM TROUBLE (10-15-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

*Today’s Verses:*

*Dear brothers and sisters, whenever trouble comes your way, let it be an
opportunity for joy. For when your faith *

*is tested, your endurance has a chance to grow. *

(Jm. 1:2-3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

James doesn’t say *if* trouble comes your way *but* whenever it does. He
assumes that we will have

troubles and that it is possible to profit from them.

The point is not to pretend to be happy when we

face pain but to have a positive outlook (“ let it be

an opportunity for joy”) because of what troubles

can produce in our life James tells us to turn our

hardships into times of learning. *Tough times can *

*teach us perseverance.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
James doesn’t say if trouble comes your way but whenever it does. He assumes that we will have troubles and that it is possible to profit from them. The point is not to pretend to be happy when we
face pain but to have a positive outlook (“ let it be
an opportunity for joy”) because of what troubles
can produce in our life James tells us to turn our hardships into times of learning. Tough times can teach us perseverance.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that even in the midst of trials and tribulations, Your purposes are greater than our understanding. Help us to see the value in the difficulties we face, for they can produce in us a steadfast faith, a persevering spirit, and a character that reflects Your glory. Grant us the wisdom to embrace these challenges with joy, knowing that they are opportunities to grow in our relationship with You. May our perseverance bear the fruit of hope, as we trust in Your unfailing love. Amen.

original_content:
message_id: 1752e0ae3ce6b8d3
subject   : Subject: WHAT TRUE FAITH INVOLVES (10-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 15 Oct 2020 15:54:27 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Now some may—argue, “Some people have faith; others have good deeds. “I
say, I can’t see your faith if you don’t have good deeds, but I will show
you my faith through my good deeds.” *(Jm. 2:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

At first glance, this verse seems to contradict (Ro.3:28), *“We are made
right with God through faith and not by obeying the law.” *Deeper
investigation, however, shows that the teachings of James and Paul are not
at odds. While it is true that our good deeds can never earn salvation,
true faith always results in a changed life and good deeds. Paul speaks
against those who try to be saved by deeds instead of faith; James speaks
against those who confuse mere intellectual assent with true faith. After
all even demons know who Jesus is, but they don’t obey Him (Jm. 2:18) *True
faith involves a commitment of your whole self *

*to God.*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text: At first glance, this verse seems to contradict (Romans 3:28), “We are made right with God through faith and not by obeying the law.” Deeper investigation, however, shows that the teachings of James and Paul are not at odds. Paul speaks against those who try to be saved by deeds instead of faith; James speaks against those who confuse mere intellectual assent with true faith. After all even demons know who Jesus is, but they don’t obey Him (James 2:18) True faith involves a commitment of your whole self to God.
original_verse_text: Now some may-argue, “Some people have faith; others have good deeds. "I say, I can’t see your faith if you don’t have good deeds, but I will show you my faith through my good deeds."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that it is by Your grace alone that we are saved, not by our own works (Ephesians 2:8-9). Yet, we know that true faith in You must be accompanied by a changed life and good deeds (James 2:18). Help us, Lord, to live out our faith, not merely professing it, but demonstrating it through our actions. May our lives be a testament to Your transformative power, that others may see our good works and glorify You (Matthew 5:16). In Your name, we pray. Amen.

While it is true that our good deeds can never earn salvation, true faith always results in a changed life and good deeds. subject   : Subject: FAITH A GIFT FROM CHRIST (10-17-20)

*Today’s Verse:*

*I am writing to all of you who share the same precious faith we have,
faith given to us by Jesus Christ, our God and Savior, who makes us right
with God.. *(2 Pet. 1:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

If our faith is real, it will be evident in our godly behavior. If people
are diligent in Christian growth, they won’t backslide or be deceived by
false teachers. Christian growth is essential. It begins with faith and
culminates in love for others. To keep growing we need to know God, keep on
following Him, and remember what He taught us. We must remain diligent in
faithful obedience and Christian growth.



Christians need discernment to be able to resist false teachers. God can
rescue us from their lies *if* *we stay true to His Word the Bible, and
reject those who distort the truth.*

* Pastor Sather*

May our lives be a reflection of Your grace, that we may not be deceived by false teachings, but remain steadfast in Your truth. *Today’s Verses:*

*Love me like a seal over your heart, or like a seal on*

* your arm. For love is as strong as death, and its jealous*

* is as enduring as the grave. Love flashes, like fire, the *

*brightest kind of flame. *(Song of songs 8:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

True love is as strong as death; it cannot be killed

By time or disaster; and it cannot be bought for any

price because it is freely given. Love is priceless,

and the richest king cannot buy it. Love must be

accepted as a gift from God and then shared with-

in the guidelines God provides. *Accept the love *

*of** your spouse as God’s gift; and strive to make *

*your** love a reflection of the perfect love that comes from **God.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Today’s Verse:*

*There are three things that will endure—faith, hope, *

*and ** Love**—and the greatest of these is Love*.

(I Cor. 13:13)

Love is the greatest of human qualities, and it is an attri-

bute of God Himself (I Jn. 4:8). Love involves unselfish,

service to others.; to show it gives evidence that you care.

*Faith* is the foundation and cement of God’s message;

*Hope* is the attitude and focus, *Love* iis the action. *When*

*faith and hope are in line, you are free to love com**ple-*

*tely because you understand how God loves.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Today’s Verses:*

*In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. The **earth was
empty, a formless mass cloaked in dark-*

*ness. And **the Spirit of God was hovering over its surface. *(Gen. 1:1-2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God did not need to create the universe; He chose to create it. WHY? God is
*love*, and love is best expressed toward something or someone else—SO God
created the world and people as an expression of His love. We should
avoid reducing
God’s creation to merely scientific terms.

*Remember that God created the universe because He*

*Loves us.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Today’s Verse:*

*“Don’t be afraid,” Moses said, “For God has come in this way **to show you
His awesome power. From now on, let your fear **of Him keep you from
sinning *(Ex. 20:20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Throughout the Bible we find this phrase: “*Don’t be afraid.” *God wasn’t
trying to scare the people. He was showing His mighty power so the
Israelites would know He was the true God and they would therefore obey
Him. If they would do this, He would make His power available to them.
God wants
us to follow Him out of l*ove* rather than fear. To overcome fear we must
think more about

His love. FirstJohn 4:18 says, *Perfect love expels all fear.*

* Pastor Sather*

He was showing His mighty power so the Israelites would know He was the true God and they would therefore obey Him. If they would do this, He would make His power available to them. God wants us to follow Him out of love rather than fear. To overcome fear we must think more about His love. FirstJohn 4:18 says, Perfect love expels all fear.

As Your children, we desire to follow You not out of dread, but out of a deep love for You. Help us to fix our eyes on Your mighty power and unwavering faithfulness, that we may walk in obedience and experience the fullness of Your strength and protection. May Your love be the driving force in our lives, that we may serve You without fear, but with joyful reverence. Amen.

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 21 Oct 2020 16:54:35 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(10-22-20)

*Today’s Verse:*

*As soon as Judas had eaten the bread, Satan entered him. *

*Then Jesus told him, “Hurry, do it now.” * (Jn. 13:27)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Satan’s part in the betrayal of Jesus does not remove any

of the responsibility from Judas. Disillusioned because

Jesus was talking about dying rather than setting up His

kingdom, Judas may have been trying to force Jesus’

hand and make Him use His power to prove He was the Messiah. Perhaps Judas
not understanding Jesus’ mission, *no longer* believed Jesus was God’s
chosen one.

Whatever Judas' thought, Satan assumed Jesus’ death would end His mission and
thwart God’s plan. *Like Judas, Satan did not **know that Jesus’ death was
the most important part of **God’s plan all along.*

* Pastor Sather*

Though Satan sought to thwart Your plan, we know that You work all things together for the good of those who love You (Romans 8:28). Help us to trust in Your sovereign will, even when we do not fully understand. May we be steadfast in our faith, even in the face of darkness and confusion. We pray that Your will be done, for Your glory and the salvation of all who believe. Amen.

message_id: 1755299e5d95b14b
subject   : Subject: SUFFERING CAN'T SPERATE US FROM THE LOVE OF GOD.
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 22 Oct 2020 18:16:59 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

(10-22-20)



*Today’s Verses:*

*Why is life given to those with no future, those destined *

*by God **to live in distress? I can not eat for sighing; my groans pour **out
like water. What I always feared has happened me.What I **dreaded has come
to be. I have *

*no peace, no quietness. I have **no rest; instead, only trouble comes. *(Job.
3:23-26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Job had been careful not to worship material possessions but to worship God
alone. Here he was overwhelmed by calamities that mocked his caution, and
he complained about trials thatcame despite his right living. All the
principles by which he had lived were crumbling, and

Job began to lose his perspective. Trials and grief,

whether temporary or enduring, do not destroy the real purpose of life.
Life is not given merely for happiness

and personal fulfillment but for us to serve and honor

God. *The worth and meaning of life is based **on the *

*one reality no one can take away—God’s love **for us.*

* Pastor Sather*

All the principles by which he had lived were crumbling, and Job began to lose his perspective.
Trials and grief, whether temporary or enduring, do not destroy the real purpose of life. Life is not given merely for happiness and personal fulfillment but for us to serve and honor God. The worth and meaning of life is based on the one reality no one can take away-God’s love for us.

What I always feared has happened me.What I dreaded has come to be. I have  no peace, no quietness. I have no rest; instead, only trouble comes.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in this time of trial and grief, when the foundations of our understanding seem to crumble. Like Job, we struggle to reconcile the calamities we face with the faith we have sought to live by. Yet, we cling to the truth that our worth and meaning are found in Your unfailing love, not in our own circumstances. Strengthen our hearts, Lord, that we may continue to serve and honor You, even in the midst of our deepest sorrows. Amen.

message_id: 17557a88e7a9fd3a
subject   : Subject: OVER COMING EVIL WITH GOOD (10-24-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 23 Oct 2020 17:51:06 -0500
===================================================================

*Today’s Verses:*

*You have heard that the law of Moses says, “Love your neighbor **and hate
your enemy. But I say, love your enemies! Pray for **those who persecute
you! * (Mt. 5:43-44)



*Today’s Reflection:*

By telling us to not retaliate, Jesus keeps us from taking the law into our
own hands. By loving and praying for our enemies, we can overcome evil with
good. The Pharisees interpreted (Lev. 19:18) as teaching that they should
love only those who love in return and (Ps. 139:19-22) as meaning they
should hate their enemies. But Jesus says

we are to love our enemies. If you love your enemies

and treat them well, you will truly show that Jesus is

Lord of your life. This is possible only for those who

give themselves fully to God, because only He can deliver people from
natural selfishness. *We must trust the Holy Spirit to help us show **love
to those for whom we may not feel love.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
By telling us to not retaliate, Jesus keeps us from taking the law into our own hands. By loving and praying for our enemies, we can overcome evil with good. The Pharisees interpreted (Leviticus 19:18) as teaching that they should love only those who love in return and (Psalm 139:19-22) as meaning they should hate their enemies. But Jesus says we are to love our enemies. If you love your enemies
and treat them well, you will truly show that Jesus is Lord of your life. This is possible only for those who give themselves fully to God, because only He can deliver people from natural selfishness.
We must trust the Holy Spirit to help us show love to those for whom we may not feel love.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your wisdom and strength. Forgive us for the times we have harbored resentment and retaliated against those who have wronged us. Help us to follow the example of Your Son, Jesus, who loved even His enemies and prayed for those who persecuted Him. May we overcome evil with good, trusting in Your power to transform hearts and lives. Guide us by Your Holy Spirit, that we may show love to those for whom we may not naturally feel love. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: By telling us to not retaliate, Jesus keeps us from taking the law into our own hands. By loving and praying for our enemies, we can overcome evil with good. But Jesus says we are to love our enemies. If you love your enemies and treat them well, you will truly show that Jesus is Lord of your life. This is possible only for those who give themselves fully to God, because only He can deliver people from natural selfishness. subject   : Subject: TALKING VS. DEMONSTRATING (10-25-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 24 Oct 2020 17:02:35 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

“Why are you thinking such evil thoughts? *Is it easier to say,**’ your
sins are forgiven’ or ‘Get up and walk? ’I will prove **that I, the Son of
man, have the authority on earth *

*to forgive** sins.” *(Mt. 9:4b-6a)


*Today’s Reflection:*

It’s easy to tell someone your sins are forgiven; it’s a lot more difficult
to reverse a case of paralysis! Jesus backed

up His words by healing the man’s legs. Jesus’ action showed that His
words were
true, He had the power to forgive as well as heal. Talk is cheap, but our
words lack meaning if our actions do not back them up. We can say we love
God or others, but if we are not taking practical steps to demonstrate that
love, our words are empty and meaningless. *How well do your act**ions back
up what you say?*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: It’s easy to tell someone your sins are forgiven; it’s a lot more difficult to reverse a case of paralysis! Jesus backed up His words by healing the man’s legs. Jesus’ action showed that His words were true, He had the power to forgive as well as heal. Talk is cheap, but our words lack meaning if our actions do not back them up. We can say we love God or others, but if we are not taking practical steps to demonstrate that love, our words are empty and meaningless. How well do your actions back up what you say?
original_verse_text: 4 Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said, “Why do you entertain evil thoughts in your hearts? 5 Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, "Get up and walk?" 6 But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins. So he said to the paralyzed man, "Get up, take your mat and go home."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the example of Jesus, who not only spoke words of forgiveness but also demonstrated His power to heal. Help us, Lord, to not only profess our love for You and for others, but to also back up our words with actions that reflect Your love and compassion. May our lives be a testament to the truth of Your Word, that our faith may be alive and active, not merely empty rhetoric. Guide us, Lord, to live out our faith in meaningful ways, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: It's easy to tell someone your sins are forgiven; it's a lot more difficult to reverse a case of paralysis! Jesus backed up His words by healing the man's legs. Jesus' action showed that His words were true; He had the power to forgive as well as heal. Talk is cheap, but our words lack meaning if our actions do not back them up. We can say we love God or others, but if we are not taking practical steps to demonstrate that love, our words are empty and meaningless. How well do your actions back up what you say?

*Today's Verses:*
*Not even a sparrow worth only half a penny, can fall to the ground*
*without your Father knowing it. and the very hairs of your head are*
*all numbered. So don't be afraid; you are more valuable to Him*
*than a whole flock of sparrows. *(Mt. 10:29-31)

*Today's Reflection:*
Jesus said that the Father is aware of everything that happens even
to sparrows, and you are far more valuable to Him then they are.You
are so valuable that He sent His only Son to die for you (Jn. 3:16).
Because God places such value on you, you never need fear personal
threats or difficult trials. these can't shake God's love or dislodge His
Spirit from within you. But this doesn't mean that God will take away
all your troubles. (see 10:16). The real test of value is how well some-
thing holds up under the wear, tear, and stress of everyday life. *Those*
*who stand up for Christ in spite of their troubles truly have lasting*
*value and will receive great rewards. *(see 5:11, 12)
* Pastor Sather*

Help us to stand firm in our faith, even when faced with trials and difficulties, for we know that Your Spirit is with us always. May we find comfort in the truth that You sent Your only Son to die for us, demonstrating the great worth You place upon us. We give thanks for Your steadfast presence and the eternal rewards that await those who remain faithful to You. Amen.

*Today, Verse:*
*If you give even a cold cup of water to one of the least of*
*my followers, you will surely be rewarded. *(Mt. 10:42)

*Today's Reflection:*
How much we love God can be measured by how well we
treat others, Jesus' example of giving a cup of cold water
to a thirsty child is a good model of unselfish service. A child
can't or won't return a favor. God notices every good deed
we do or don't do as if He were the one receiving it.is there
something unselfish you can do for someone else today?
*Although no one else may see you, God will notice.*
*Pastor Sather*

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, humbled by Your call to serve the least of these. May we follow the example of Your Son, who showed compassion to the vulnerable and the forgotten. Help us to see Your face in every person we encounter, and grant us the wisdom and courage to offer a cup of cold water, a kind word, or an act of selfless love, knowing that in doing so, we serve You. May our lives be a reflection of Your boundless grace and mercy. Amen.

*Today's Verses:*
*Let me use this illustration. You can not enter a strong*
*man's house and rob him without first tying him up. Only*
*then can his house be robbed. Anyone who isn't helping*
*me opposes me, and anyone who isn't working with me*
*is actually working against me. *(Mt. 12:29-30)

*Today's Reflection:*
We need to remember this, that at Jesus' birth, Satan's power
and control were disrupted. In the wilderness Jesus overcame
Satan's temptations, and at the resurrection He defeated Satan's
ultimate weapon-death. Eventually Satan will be constrained for-
ever. (Rev. 20:10),and evil will no longer prevail on earth.Jesus
has complete power and authority over Satan and all his forces.
it is impossible to be neutral about Christ. Anyone who is not act-
ively following Him has chosen to reject Him. Any person who
attempts to remain neutral in the struggle of good against evil is
choosing to be separated from God who alone is good.*To refuse*
*to follow Christ is to choose to be on Satan's side.*
* Pastor Sather*

Lord, strengthen our faith and embolden us to stand firm against the schemes of the devil. May we never waver in our commitment to You, the only true and righteous God. Amen.

*Sin will be rampant everywhere, and the love of many **will *
*grow cold. But those who endure to the end will **be saved. *
(Mt, 24:12-13)

*Today's Reflection:*
With false teaching and loose morals comes a particularly
destructive disease--the loss of true love for God and others.
Sin can cool our love for God and others by turning our focus
on ourselves. We cannot truly love if we think only of our-
selves. *In verse thirteen we see the benefits of standing *
*firm, and **continue to live for Christ.*
*Pastor Sather*

Sin can cool our love for God and others by turning our focus on ourselves. We cannot truly love if we think only of our selves. In verse thirteen we see the benefits of standing firm, and continue to live for Christ.

Grant us the strength to persevere in the face of trials, that we may receive the crown of life You have promised to those who love You. May our love for You and for our neighbors be a testimony to Your transforming power. In Jesus' name, Amen.

subject   : Subject: JESUS SPEAKS WITH THE RICH MAN (10-30-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 29 Oct 2020 15:58:23 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today's Verse:*
*Jesus felt genuine love for the rich man as He looked at Him.*
*"You lack only one thing." He told him. "Go and sell all you*
*have and give to the the money to the poor, and you will have*
*treasures in heaven. Then come and follow me." *(Mk. 10:21)

*Today's Reflection:*
With this verse, let us start thinking and ask ourselves: "What
does money mean to me?" Jesus showed genuine love for
this man, even though He knew this man may not follow Him.
True love is able to give tough advice, it does not hedge on
the truth. Remember Christ loved us enough to die for us, and
He also loves us enough to talk straight to us. *IF *His love were
superficial, He would give us only His approval; *BUT* because
His love is complete, He gives us life-changing challenges.
*Pastor Sather*

Jesus showed genuine love for this man, even though He knew this man may not follow Him. True love is able to give tough advice, it does not hedge on the truth. Remember Christ loved us enough to die for us, and He also loves us enough to talk straight to us. IF His love were superficial, He would give us only His approval; BUT because His love is complete, He gives us life-changing challenges.

Help us to examine our relationship with money and material possessions, that we may not be enslaved by the pursuit of wealth, but rather find our true treasure in You. Give us the courage to heed Your loving challenges, even when they are difficult, that we may follow You wholeheartedly. May our love for You eclipse all else, that we may serve You alone. In Jesus' name, Amen.

*Today' Verses:*
*God created everything there is. Nothing exists that He didn't make.*
*Life itself was in Him, and His life gives light to everyone. the light*
*shines through the darkness, and the darkness can never extin-*
*guish it.*

*Today's Reflection:*
Do you ever feel that your life is to complex for God to understand?
Remember God created the entire universe, and nothing is to diff-
cult for Him.*God created you; He is alive today, and His love is*

*Saturday's Verse:*
*For God so loved the world that he gave His only **Son, *
*so that every one that believes in Him will **not perish but *
*have eternal life. *(Jn. 3:16)

*Saturday's Reflection:*
"To believe," is more than an intellectual agreement that
Jesus is God. It means to put our trust and confidence in
Him, that He alone can save us. It is to put Christ in charge
of our plans and eternal destiny. Believing is both trusting
His words as reliable, and relying on Him for the power to
change. *If you have never trusted Christ, let His promise*
*of everlasting life be yours and believe.*
*Pastor Sather*

*Subject: WHY LOVING OTHERS IS SO *

* IMPORTANT *(11-1-20)

*Today’s Verses:*

*So now I am giving you a new commandment: love each*

*other, just as I have loved you, you should love each*

*other. Your love for one another will prove to the world*

*that you are My disciples. *(Jn. 13:34-35)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus says that our Christ-like love will show we are

His disciples. Do people see petty bickering, jealousy,

and division in your church? Do they know you are

Jesus’ followers? Or do they know you are Jesus’ followers by your love for
one another? *Let us remember love is **more than simply warm feelings; *

*it is an attitude **that reveals itself in actions.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Jesus says that our Christ-like love will show we are His disciples.
Do people see petty bickering, jealousy, and division in your church? Do they know you are Jesus’ followers?
Or do they know you are Jesus’ followers by your love for one another? Let us remember love is more than simply warm feelings; it is an attitude that reveals itself in actions.

Your love for one another will prove to the world that you are My disciples.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You have called us to love one another as You have loved us. Help us to move beyond mere words and to demonstrate our love through tangible acts of kindness, compassion, and service. May our love for one another be a reflection of Your love, that the world may know we are Your disciples. Guide us to live out the truth that love is not just a feeling, but a way of life. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
